translation.en: [man] Beer.
A wise man once said that beer makes you feel the way you ought to feel without beer.
translation.es: Un sabio dijo que con cerveza te sientescomo deberías sentirte sin cerveza.

translation.en: Couldn't agree more. First one's on the house.
translation.es: Estoy de acuerdo.La casa invita la primera.

translation.en: Uh, actually, I'm looking for the Accommodator.
Sorry. We don't have the Accommodator.
Yeah, it's not a beer. It's a dildo.
translation.es: Sí, no es una cerveza. Es un consolador.

translation.en: [stammering] What? Why does everyone think this is a porn shop?
translation.es: ¿Qué? ¿Por qué todoscreen que es una tienda porno?

translation.en: Well, we're in Van Nuys,
and you spelled "extreme" with triple X's, so...
Okay, because my last name is Rodman, and the beer,
translation.es: Porque mi apellido es Rodman, y la cerveza, como ya verás,es muy extrema.

translation.en: as you will taste, is very extreme.
translation.es: y la cerveza, como ya verás,es muy extrema.

translation.en: -This is my most drinkable ale. -Mmm! It's called the Rod Guzzler.
translation.es: Este es mi ale más fácil de beber.Se llama Trágatela Toda.

translation.en: Yeah.
-This is bright beer. Nothing fresher. -Bright beer.
translation.es: - Es cerveza brillante. Muy fresca.- Cerveza brillante.

translation.en: -Okay. -[Rodman] Yeah.
[customer] Mmm! Incredible.
If you just sold dildos and fetish wear
like you advertise, this place would be a home run, Wilheim.
translation.es: como parece,el lugar sería un éxito, Wilheim.

translation.en: My name's Wilhelm.
My real name's Will, but I had it legally changed to Wilhelm,
translation.es: En realidad es Will,pero lo cambié a Wilheim

translation.en: in honor of the Bavarian duke responsible for the Reinheitsgebot,
translation.es: por el duque bávaroresponsable del Reinheitsgebot,

translation.en: which is the beer purity law of 1516.
translation.es: la ley de pureza de cerveza de 1516.

translation.en: Ooh, Chuy, Chuy, Ch-Chuy! Come here!
Come here. You gotta meet this guy.
Chuy used to work at the auto body shop next door, and I poached him because he wanted a little career change.
translation.es: Chuy trabajaba en el taller de al lado.Quería un cambio de carrera y lo robé.

translation.en: I wanna be a businessman, so I watch him.
translation.es: Quiero ser empresario,así que lo observo.

translation.en: Oh, thank you, Chuy.
If I just do the opposite of whatever he does, sky's the limit for me.
translation.es: Hago lo contrario a lo que él hace.El cielo es el límite.

translation.en: -[Wilhelm laughs] Yeah. -Okay.
Hey, boss, tonight I'm throwing a tasting party  for my soccer buds.
translation.es: Jefe, esta noche haré una degustaciónpara mis amigos de fútbol.

translation.en: Mind if I take home a little research?
Take whatever you want. You know that's the rule.
translation.es: Llévate lo que quieras.Esas son las reglas.

translation.en: Thank you. Later, man.
What a great guy, right?
-Incredible. -He's a gem.
-[customer] You're lucky to have him. -Nope, drop it.
translation.es: - Tienes suerte de tenerlo.- No, déjalo.

translation.en: Oh, man.
Your car's being towed.
Oh, shit.
-Mm-kay. Bye. -[customer] Oh, shit.
-So sorry. See you again. -Bye, Ben. Nice meeting you.
translation.es: - Lo siento. Nos vemos.- Fue un placer.

translation.en: -Bye! Okay. -Hope you get your dildo.
Stop letting Chuy take the booze. Will, what are you doing?
translation.es: No dejes que Chuy se lleve la bebida.Will, ¿qué haces?

translation.en: -LeBron James or Abe Lincoln? -[laughs]
-Colonel Sanders. -[coughs]
Oh, my God, Will, get your shit together.
[laughing] Everything is gonna be fine, okay?
The distributor's coming by today. He likes our beer.
translation.es: El distribuidor vendrá hoy.Le gusta la cerveza. ¡Wir sind prima!

translation.en: -We're golden. Stop being a buzzkill. -Oh, my God. I--
I see how much you drink, okay? Nothing can kill your buzz.
translation.es: Veo cuánto bebes.Nadie te agua la fiesta.

translation.en: Even your dog is day drunk.
So what? He's a little drunk.
-Friar Lucas knows when to say when. -Does he?
Come here. I got a question for you.
-Why did you put the darts on this side? -[Wilhelm] Ah, let me tell you why.
translation.es: ¿Por qué pusiste los dardos de este lado? Te lo diré.

translation.en: I needed room for my latest genius promotion.
translation.es: Necesitaba espaciopara mi última promoción genial.

translation.en: Ta-da, huh? Pretty good.
You take a growler home with you, and then you get another one for free when you come back.
translation.es: Cargas un growler, te lo llevas a casa,lo traes y lo recargas.

translation.en: -It's gonna catch on like wildfire. -[older man grunting]
translation.es: Se va a poner de moda.

translation.en: I think it already has.
No, hey, that is the wrong kind of growler. You can't do that here!
translation.es: ¿Qué estás haciendo?No puedes hacer eso aquí.

translation.en: Hey, the sign says I can. "Take a growler, leave a growler." Same thing.
translation.es: El cartel dice que sí."Caga y recaga". Eso hago.

translation.en: No, not my kind of growlers.
-Please, get out of here. -[squelches]
Oh, no, no, no!
Yes. You see, to my point, I'm taking a growler here, and this morning,
translation.es: Sí, como ves, estoy recagandoy esta mañana

translation.en: I left a growler there. You see? Same thing.
-You need shoes. -It's sanitary.
-I... don't need these anymore. -[groans]
You have to promise me you will stop taking a growler!
But can I leave a growler?
I'm gonna give you my shoes, and you're gonna go, okay?
translation.es: Te daré mis zapatos y te irás, ¿sí?

translation.en: [older man] But that I could, my dear man.
Since the death of printed media, I'm at a loss for wipes, hmm?
translation.es: Desde la muerte de los medios impresos,no tengo con qué limpiarme.

translation.en: Ever tried to wipe your ass with a Kindle?
translation.es: Es difícil limpiarse con un Kindle.

translation.en: -[groans] -No!
-Back to the statehouse, Senator. -Senator? What?
The rock shoe of the white, urban climber.
[man] Hmm. The hops are timid, and there's a meek earthiness vying for attention.
translation.es: El lúpulo es tímidoy hay un sabor terroso que busca atención.

translation.en: [smacks lips] Detecting a delicate bouquet of pine with notes of citrus.
translation.es: Detecto un delicado aroma a pinocon notas cítricas.

translation.en: Possibly clementines?
-[Chuy] He's good. -[smacks lips]
If the brewmaster remembered that he was making a beer
translation.es: Si el maestro cervecerorecordara que es cerveza

translation.en: and not a smoothie, you might really have something here.
translation.es: y no un licuado, podrían tener algo.

translation.en: Unfortunately, the beer, much like the brewmaster himself,
translation.es: Por desgracia, la cerveza,al igual que el maestro cervecero,

translation.en: smells like, as he would say, "Scheiße!" [chuckles]
-You can pour that out. -Hello, Adam.
-Nice to see you, too. -[Adam] Hi.
Wait. Who's this guy?
-My brother. -Bring it in.
-[thuds] -[laughs] Oh, shit!
[chuckles softly] Family.
-Will, I didn't know you had a brother. -Yeah, I haven't seen Oxy in a long time.
translation.es: No sabía que tenías un hermano. No veía a Oxi hace mucho.

translation.en: Aww, that's a cute nickname.
Unless it's short for Oxycontin. [chuckles]
No, it's short for oxidation.
Oxidation destroys beer... and Adam destroys everything.
translation.es: La oxidación destruye la cervezay Adam destruye todo.

translation.en: I can get you Oxy. We should be so close.
translation.es: - Puedo conseguirte oxi.- Solíamos llevarnos muy bien.

translation.en: [Wilhelm] Adam and I were adopted by farmers in beautiful Yakima Valley.
translation.es: Nos adoptaron granjerosen el hermoso valle de Yakima.

translation.en: And as you know, that's where 70% of American hops are grown.
translation.es: Ahí se cultivael 70 % del lúpulo de EE. UU., como saben.

translation.en: [woman] Nobody knows that, and nobody cares. I'm actually angry that I know now.
translation.es: Nadie lo sabe y a nadie le importa.Estoy enojada por saberlo ahora.

translation.en: [Wilhelm] Pipe down! I'm painting a picture.
Adam snuck me my first beer, and I thought it was horrible.
translation.es: Adam me dio mi primera cerveza y me pareció horrible.

translation.en: And that's when he said, "We can make it better."
translation.es: Ahí fue cuando dijo:"Podemos hacer una mejor".

translation.en: The next few years, we became the best beer-making duo around.
translation.es: En los siguientes años,nos convertimos en el mejor dúo cervecero.

translation.en: We even entered a beer contest. [woman] You guys entered a beer contest when you were that young?
translation.es: - Hasta participamos en un concurso.- ¿Un concurso de cerveza? ¿Tan pequeños?

translation.en: -[crowd cheering] -[Wilhelm] And we won.
-[woman] That's great. -[Wilhelm] Not great.
Adam really wanted to use his beer, but I knew mine was better, so...
translation.es: Adam quería usar su cervezapero yo sabía que la mía era mejor.

translation.en: at the last minute, I switched them.
When he found out...
...he was pissed.
I will never work with you again.
Traitor! [grunts]
And I never saw him again... till today.
translation.es: Y nunca lo volví a ver hasta hoy.

translation.en: Look, the guy makes really, really good beer.
translation.es: El tipo hace una cerveza excelente.

translation.en: -It's just that-- -Will, like, come on.
You spent your money on a place that's way too big,
translation.es: Gastaste tu dineroen un lugar demasiado grande

translation.en: and there's barely any customers.
Um, by the way, boss, "taking a growler" means "to shit."
Where were you a week ago?
Whatever you think about your brother, if he makes amazing beer,
translation.es: Sea lo que sea tu hermano,si hace una cerveza increíble,

translation.en: why not give him a shot?
So...
I have discussed it with my team, and we have decided
translation.es: lo hablé con mi equipo y decidimos que trabajes con nosotros,con condiciones.

translation.en: to let you work with us on the following conditions--
translation.es: y decidimos que trabajes con nosotros,con condiciones.

translation.en: I accept.
We gotta make a lot of changes around here. You gotta change the way you're marketing this place.
translation.es: Hay que cambiar muchas cosas,como la publicidad de este lugar.

translation.en: Yes, okay, great. That's exactly what we shall do.
translation.es: Bien. Eso es lo que haremos.

translation.en: [Adam] Okay, let's get rid of that barrel, these menus.
-What? -Get rid of those games. No chairs, no tables.
Send 'em back to the junkyard I assume you got them from.
Maybe board up these windows.
-Why? -'Cause they look like shit.
Okay, pool tables and beer pong, here we come.
translation.es: - Mesas de billar y ping pong de cerveza.- No, lo contrario.

translation.en: No, the opposite. We want this whole place to be stripped down.
translation.es: - Mesas de billar y ping pong de cerveza.- No, lo contrario. Que todo sea despojado.

translation.en: We want people to be able to meditate on the beer.
translation.es: Que la gente medite sobre la cerveza.

translation.en: I want our customers to see the way I prepare the grist for the mash tun.
translation.es: Que los clientes veancómo hago la molienda para el macerado.

translation.en: -Oh, my God, he is worse than you. -Told ya.
translation.es: - Es peor que tú.- Te lo dije.

translation.en: And you guys could really stand to fix yourselves up a little bit.
translation.es: Y ustedes podrían arreglarse un poco.

translation.en: Do you work here?
Yes.
Yes, Chuy, you work here.
-Yes! Yes. -Yes, you do. You do.
Okay, great. And you're wearing sandals in a brewery?
-Pool wear? -Yes.
-Yes. -[Adam] All right.
There's something about you. I like you. Put your hair up, pull it back.
translation.es: Tienes algo. Me caes bien. Recógete el cabello,que sea más presentable.

translation.en: Make it more presentable.
translation.es: Recógete el cabello,que sea más presentable.

translation.en: Okay. Yeah, sure thing.
-[Adam] Sick! Look at her ear. It's bad. -What?
-Y-Your ear is all messed up. -Oh, my God. Calm down.
translation.es: - Tu oreja está mal.- Vaya. Cálmate. Es una oreja de coliflor.

translation.en: It's just cauliflower ear.
translation.es: Cálmate. Es una oreja de coliflor.

translation.en: Yeah, but it is gross. Looks like a dog chewed on it.
It stinks, too.
-It stinks? -[woman] It doesn't.
Sarah used to be an MMA fighter. Yeah, and I had to retire after I got injured.
translation.es: - Sarah era luchadora de MMA.- Me retiré porque me lesioné.

translation.en: -Oh, my God. -[Sarah] It's an injury.
I bet people are so happy to not see that melted thing.
translation.es: Nadie quiere ver esa cosa derretida.

translation.en: What? They love it, okay? They love me and my ear.
translation.es: Les encanto y les encanta mi oreja.

translation.en: [Adam] Okay.
-Bye. Bye. -[Sarah] Come on, we got shit to do.
-[Adam groans] -Hello, hello. Welcome to Rodman's.
What can I get you?
Hi. Um, can I have a Stella?
We actually only serve our own beer here, so we don't have Stella,
translation.es: Solo servimos nuestra cerveza aquí.No hay Stella,

translation.en: but I'd be happy to find you something that is similar--
Sorry, you want a Stella?
No, Stella is the most unoriginal beer in the world.
translation.es: Es la cerveza menos original del mundo.

translation.en: So that means that you're the most unoriginal person in the world.
translation.es: O sea que eresla persona menos original del mundo.

translation.en: What about you? Hi, how are you?
-What are you thinking of having? -Do you have something like a Bud Light?
translation.es: - ¿Qué quieres tomar?- ¿Hay algo como Bud Light?

translation.en: No, no, no.
Bud Light, Bud Light, Bud Light. [snorts, spits]
You can lap that up. It'll taste like Bud Light.
translation.es: Puedes beber eso. Sabe a Bud Light.

translation.en: That's so gross.
I apologize on his behalf. The drinks are on me.
translation.es: Me disculpo por él.Las bebidas son gratis.

translation.en: -We'll go to a different bar. -Weird.
[Wilhelm] If we could buy your first round--
-No! Please come back again! -[door slams]
What are you doing? You can't turn people away.
translation.es: ¿Qué haces?No puedes rechazar a la gente.

translation.en: Come on, they were barely people.
They wanted to drink a Stella and a Bud Light.
translation.es: Querían beber Stella y Bud Light.

translation.en: Beer is about bringing people together,
translation.es: La cerveza une a la gente

translation.en: and Rodman's is the perfect hang.
translation.es: y Rodman's es el lugar ideal.

translation.en: What matters most is making the perfect beer.
translation.es: Solo importahacer la cerveza perfecta. Nada más.

translation.en: -Everything else is immaterial. -[Wilhelm] No.
translation.es: Solo importahacer la cerveza perfecta. Nada más. No, Oxi.Lo más importante es servir a la gente

translation.en: What matters most is serving people,
translation.es: No, Oxi.Lo más importante es servir a la gente

translation.en: regardless of their beer preference, race, religion.
translation.es: de todas las preferencias,razas y religiones.

translation.en: That's the German way. No, I don't think that's right.
translation.es: - Es el estilo alemán.- No opino lo mismo.

translation.en: [Wilhelm] I've never needed you.
When you went off to Oregon State at 14 to get your stupid beer degree...
translation.es: Cuando te fuiste a los 14 a la universidada estudiar tu carrera estúpida...

translation.en: My master's of agricultural chemistry and zymurgy?
...I was learning how to make beer the hard way:
translation.es: ...yo aprendía a hacer cervezaal estilo rudo:

translation.en: on the streets and outdoor plazas of Europe.
translation.es: en las calles y plazas de Europa.

translation.en: Do have any idea how many beer gardens I drank my way through
translation.es: ¿Sabes en cuántos patios cerveceros bebípara perfeccionar mi oficio?

translation.en: -before I perfected my craft? -[Adam] And what craft is that?
translation.es: ¿Sabes en cuántos patios cerveceros bebípara perfeccionar mi oficio? ¿Qué oficio?

translation.en: Throwing up on yourself and then contracting super gonorrhea from a youth hostel toilet seat?
translation.es: ¿Vomitarte y contraer gonorreaen un inodoro de hostal?

translation.en: So you do follow me on Instagram!
Okay, so you were able to drag your gonorrhea-riddled member
translation.es: Pudiste arrastrartu miembro lleno de gonorrea

translation.en: into a monastery where they make beer, and you memorized their recipes.
translation.es: hasta un monasterio que hacía cervezay memorizaste sus recetas.

translation.en: That does not make you a Braumeister.
That makes you a Xerox machine.
What's a Xerox machine?
Can you get her out of here, please? Go.
Hi, sir. Welcome to Rodman's. What can I get you?
translation.es: Hola, señor. Bienvenido a Rodman's.¿Qué le sirvo?

translation.en: I'll have whatever you recommend.
[Wilhelm] Whatever I recommend. Excellent.
Adam, this is how you run a brewery. Let me pull my Rodman Stiff Stout for you.
translation.es: Adam, así se atiende a la gente. Le daré mi Stout Rodman Bien Dura.

translation.en: Oh, I gotta change that name.
And he wonders why people think we're a sex store.
translation.es: Por eso creen que es un sex shop.

translation.en: -[Adam] People don't think about you guys. -Here you go, sir.
translation.es: No creen nada de ustedes. Aquí tiene, señor.

translation.en: -[man] Thank you. -[Wilhelm] Take a sip.
-[man] Tasty. -Thank you.
-[smacks lips] Are you Wilhelm Rodman? -Mm-hmm.
You are three months behind on your rent.
Pay up or you're gonna be evicted.

translation.en: This is really good.
It's definitely not,
and I would've gotten him out of here two or three months ago.

[in German] You are fucked!
[in English] I picked up a few things.
[Wilhelm] Okay, we are not going out of business.
We need to spend all of our time in putting together the perfect flight
translation.es: Tenemos que concentrarnosen crear la selección ideal

translation.en: to impress the hell outta this distributor.
What's your favorite beer? I can run to Angel City and pick up a few kegs.

translation.en: [gasps] That's genius.
I mean, I-I love where this guy's head is at.

translation.en: -You're great. -Thank you.
-I don't like where this is going. -It feels good here.

translation.en: What the fuck?
-[woman grunts] -[Wilhelm] You came in a little hot again.

translation.en: [woman] Sorry about that.
translation.es: - Lo siento.- Es muy difícil estacionar

translation.en: It's really hard to park when digitally stimulating each other.

Hey, this is my brother Adam.
[chuckles] You guys look nothing alike.
-Thank you. -Danke.
-You look like lovers. -[Wilhelm] What?
[woman] Yeah, lovers.
-[man] Do you ever...? -No!

Kids Menu! Open for business!
-Chicken fingers! Corn dogs! -Mac and cheese!

translation.en: Juice boxes! Everything organic...
-[both] ...and locally sourced. -[Adam] Wow.
And adults actually consume this stuff?
Hell yeah, dude. Everyone loves ordering off the kids' menu.

translation.en: -Who doesn't love a kids' menu? -Right? But restaurants make it off-limits for grown-ups.
translation.es: ¿A quién no? Pero los restauranteslo prohíben para los adultos.

translation.en: -[man] For us... -[both] ...nothing is off-limits.
-That's what I was gonna say. -I was gonna say that.
translation.es: - Yo iba a decir eso.- Yo también.

translation.en: -You're not-- oh, my-- -[both moaning]
[Wilhelm] Nothing's off-limits. How do you do it? You live together, you work together.
translation.es: Nada está prohibido.¿Cómo lo hacen? Viven y trabajan juntos.

translation.en: I'm presuming that you don't share deodorant together.
Correct. Deodorant is a tool of the government
translation.es: Correcto. Con el desodorante,el gobierno te sigue.

translation.en: -to track you. -[woman] To control you.
translation.es: Correcto. Con el desodorante,el gobierno te sigue. - Te controla.- Tiene sal...

translation.en: They put, uh, salt in it--
Aluminum, baby.
Thank you, babe. They put aluminum in it, and that's how they know where you are.
translation.es: Gracias. Le ponen aluminio y así saben dónde estás.

translation.en: God, it is so concerning that you run a food truck and you confused aluminum and salt.
translation.es: Tienes un camión de comiday confundiste aluminio y sal. Me preocupa.

translation.en: Oh, no, they're both fine to eat.
-You can just not put one under your arm. -[woman] Yeah.
translation.es: - Pero uno no va en la axila.- Sí.

translation.en: Do you guys ever get sick of each other?
We've been together ten months and haven't spent a moment apart.
translation.es: Llevamos diez meses juntosy nunca nos separamos.

translation.en: -Not one moment. -What about when you go to the bathroom?
translation.es: Ni un momento. ¿Y cuándo van al baño?

translation.en: [both] What about it?
-Can I order something? -Yes. We need hairnets.

translation.es: - Necesitamos gorros.- La higiene es fundamental.

Okay.
Cool, cool, cool. I'm gonna go.

You didn't dig in deep back there.
Here, want me to give you a lift? Step on my hand.

translation.en: -[Wilhelm] Adam! -Yeah.
I think he's about to put a hairnet over his hat.

-[man] Hello. -[Wilhelm] Hi.
-East Valley Craft Distribution. -[Wilhelm] Yes.
-Wilhelm Rodman, brewmaster. -[Adam] Hello.
Adam Rodman. Hi. Head brewmaster.
-Hi there. Hi. -Okay. Hi.
-[laughing] -[Adam] Don't make it weird.
-Let him go. -All right.

-Cool. -[Adam] Mm-hmm.
So, uh, which one of you is in charge?
[both] I am.
Family business, like the Lehman Brothers.
[stammers] Yeah. Uh, big fans.
You don't know who they are. They stole a lot of money. [laughs]

Okay. Great.
"Bedazzle" him?
-Oof! That was bad, even for you. -I am nervous!

Off the top of my head, I think the Tipsy Cow

translation.en: and the Local Peasant have a tap open for local brews.

translation.en: Uh, I mean, I-I really enjoy the short-rib poutine.

translation.en: -Are you writing that down? -[Adam] I'm not.
-I see you writing things down. -It looks like that, but I'm not.
translation.es: Te veo escribiendo cosas. Parece eso, pero...

translation.en: You just wrote down what I like to eat. I honestly did not. You can trust me.
translation.es: - Escribiste lo que me gusta comer.- No, en serio. Créeme.

translation.en: -Okay. -But I-I'm curious, how often do these establishments clean out their taps?

translation.en: Uh, I don't-- When they're supposed to?
-Okay, that's all I need. -[Cole] Are you writing that down?
-This isn't gonna work out. -Excuse me?
Wait, are you interviewing me? I'm interviewing you.
-[Wilhelm] No! -[Adam] Now that the interview's over, I am willing to admit to you I've been writing things down.
translation.es: Ahora que la entrevista terminó,admito que sí anoté cosas.

translation.en: I knew it. You wrote it all down.
Adam! Adam! I'm so sorry about him.
Why don't you take a quick sample of our four most popular beers?
-[Cole] Okay. -[Adam] Let me stop you.
I believe that we have a right to know if the food these establishments are serving
translation.es: Tenemos derecho a sabersi la comida de estos locales

translation.en: tastes like, as you would say, große Scheiße,
translation.es: sabe a, como tú dirías, grosse Scheiße.

translation.en: which is German for--
-Yeah, I know what it means. -It's like "big shit."
-[Cole] Yeah. -I don't know if you knew that.
translation.es: - Sí.- No sé si lo sabías.

translation.en: -I knew it. -[Adam] Okay.
You know what I think? I think we're done here.
Done? You're gonna order without sampling?
Incredible. How many kegs can we sign you up for?
I think I'll order... nein. Which is German for "none."
translation.es: Quiero nein. Que en alemán significa "ninguno".

translation.en: -[Adam] Oh, no, it's not. -See what I did?
No, nein would actually just be "no."
[Wilhelm] Cole, please, please--
-[Adam] Bye! -What are you doing?
I just hope the next guy's more collaborative. That's what I'll say.
translation.es: Espero que el próximosea más colaborador.

translation.en: What next guy? There's one guy in Van Nuys! One guy!
translation.es: ¿Qué próximo?¡Hay un tipo en Van Nuys! Uno solo.

translation.en: There's one distributor, and it's that guy? [grunts]
Van Nuys, it's a bad place-- [groans]
-Is this what happened to your ear? -Shut up, you baby!
translation.es: - ¿Esto le pasó a tu oreja?- Cállate, nenito.

translation.en: You know what? -I never should've tracked you down. -I never should've accepted your offer.
translation.es: - No debí haberte buscado.- No debí haber aceptado tu oferta.

translation.en: This place is even more of a disaster than your melted ear.
translation.es: Este lugar es peor que tu oreja derretida.Me da lástima Chuy.

translation.en: -I feel bad for Chuy. -Wanna go for round two?
translation.es: Este lugar es peor que tu oreja derretida.Me da lástima Chuy. - ¿Una segunda ronda?- No.

translation.en: -[Adam] I don't! -See where he parked?
translation.es: - ¿Una segunda ronda?- No. - ¿Dónde estacionó?- Lo encontraré.

translation.en: -I'll find him. -[Wilhelm] Thanks.
You are doing the same thing you always do.
translation.es: Oxi, estás haciendo lo mismo de siempre.

translation.en: -You ruin everything. -Oh, hard disagree.
No, don't sit. You're out. Get out.
-I'm out? -Uh-huh.
-[Adam] Okay. -This is done.
-[Adam] Okay, great. -Yeah.
-Bye. -See ya. This was a wonderful reunion.
Bye.
-Fuck. -What?
I have nowhere else to go.
What do you mean? You said you were killing it in Portland.
translation.es: ¿Qué quieres decir?Dijiste que eras un éxito en Portland.

translation.en: [Adam] I was.
I had a falling out with the local brewers.
translation.es: - Discutí con los cerveceros locales.- Hay como cien cervecerías.

translation.en: -There's, like, 100 breweries out there. -There's 84.
translation.es: - Discutí con los cerveceros locales.- Hay como cien cervecerías. Hay 84. Y muchas son muy malas.

translation.en: And a lot of them are very bad.
translation.es: Hay 84. Y muchas son muy malas.

translation.en: Some of them, their best brews taste like the cadaver of a local garbageman.
translation.es: En algunas, sus mejores cervezassaben a un basurero muerto.

translation.en: I say that as a fan.
Did you tell them that?
Yes, I told them that, okay? It was at a beer expo.
translation.es: Sí. Fue en una exposición de cerveza.

translation.en: Someone gave me a microphone, I started riffing, and people couldn't handle it.
translation.es: Me dieron un micrófono,hablé y no lo soportaron.

translation.en: I also had a problem with the fact that they were letting IPAs into the competitions.
translation.es: Tampoco me gustó que aceptaran IPAen la competencia.

translation.en: IPAs are what people drink when they're all out of good ideas
translation.es: La gente bebe IPAcuando se quedó sin buenas ideas

translation.en: or never had a good idea to begin with.
translation.es: o nunca tuvo una buena idea.

translation.en: -[booing] -Oh-- Okay, okay, yeah!
So I submitted an IPA that had a hallucinogen in it.
translation.es: Así que presenté un IPAque tenía un alucinógeno.

translation.en: You tried to drug everyone?
That's the difference between you and me.
You try, I succeed.
translation.es: Tú lo intentas, yo lo logro.

translation.en: -[dance music playing] -[distorted] How's that for an IPA?
You can't tell, but I'm giving you all the finger.
translation.es: No lo notan,pero a todos los insulto con el dedo.

translation.en: So for that reason, I'm no longer allowed to brew in Portland,
translation.es: Por eso,ya no puedo hacer cerveza en Portland.

translation.en: or be in Portland...
or be in Oregon. I gotta stay here.
translation.es: Ni en Oregón. Debo quedarme aquí.

translation.en: You're a bad person if you make me leave... frankly.
translation.es: Eres una mala personasi me echas, sinceramente.

translation.en: Simcoe, from back home.
Hmm, pretty sure it's Columbus.
I can't believe I'm about to say this,
translation.es: No puedo creer que diga esto,

translation.en: but I guess we can try working together again.
translation.es: pero podemos intentartrabajar juntos de nuevo.

translation.en: Thank you. I appreciate that.
And this room'll do. -This-- It'll do. So, we're good. -What? No.
The bed feels like the natural spot.
translation.es: - La cama parece ideal.- No, Adam.

translation.en: -Oh, yeah. -Don't! -Come on, man, that's my spot. -Sorry about the shoes.
translation.es: - No hagas eso. Es mi lugar.- Perdón por los zapatos.

translation.en: There's so many other spots you can live.
-I belong here. -It's my bed.
translation.es: - Me gusta aquí.- Es mi cama.

translation.en: -It feels like it's my bed. -You don't wanna sleep there.
translation.es: - Se siente como mi cama.- No duermas ahí.

translation.en: I jerk off... a lot...
-here. -You want to talk about that right now?
No, I'm just saying, I wouldn't want to, like, lay in your juice,
translation.es: No. Es que no me gustaríaacostarme sobre tu jugo,

translation.en: -so why would you want to lay-- -In my "juice"?
-You want to know what I do? -No.
I edge myself to orgasm
but once a month. Twelve times a year. You know math?
translation.es: excepto una vez al mes.Doce veces al año. ¿Sabes contar?

translation.en: And basically, you pleasure yourself right to the point of climax,
translation.es: Básicamente, te excitas hasta casi llegar al clímaxy luego paras.

translation.en: and then you dial it back.
translation.es: hasta casi llegar al clímaxy luego paras.

translation.en: And you do that every single day for 30 days,
translation.es: Lo haces todos los díaspor 30 días,

translation.en: and then right on that last day, you just... explode.
translation.es: y luego el último día, simplemente explotas.

translation.en: And what you produce is like a bottle-conditioned saison:
translation.es: Produces algo que pareceuna saison estacionada:

translation.en: frothy, rich, distinct.
Right now, I'm kinda sensitive 'cause I'm on day nine.
translation.es: Ahora estoy sensibleporque es el noveno día.

translation.en: So... fermentation has just begun.
I am frickin' amazing.
I convinced the distributor to come back in a couple weeks,
translation.es: Convencí al distribuidorde que que regresara en unas semanas

translation.en: on two conditions.
One: he's not allowed to talk.
Oh, no.
Two: I promised you'd make a new beer for him.
translation.es: Dos: harán una nueva cerveza para él.

translation.en: -Yes, yes, yes, yes. -[Sarah laughs] Sarah, you-- you're incredible.
I know.
What to brew? What to brew?
What about a lager?
A lager? No, it takes too long to brew. Not that I've made one since I was in diapers.
translation.es: No, tarda demasiado.Las hago desde que estaba en pañales.

translation.en: What about a rauch porter?
No. Smoked ale, it's too risky.
What if we make something that everyone's into, like a hazy IPA?
translation.es: ¿Algo que guste a todos,como IPA opaca?

translation.en: That's exactly why we shouldn't make it.
Wait, there's different kinds of beers? Why?
Fine, if it'll make you stop whining, I'll make something hoppier.
translation.es: Si dejas de quejarte,haré algo con más lúpulo.

translation.en: Oh, my God, I'm in LA for one day, and I'm already selling out.
translation.es: Un día en L. A.y ya me estoy vendiendo.

translation.en: No, I'm used to making them. I'm gonna make it.
translation.es: Yo siempre las hago. La haré yo.

translation.en: -You? -Yeah.
You think you can brew a better beer than me, Wilhelm the Lesser?
translation.es: ¿Crees que harías una cervezamejor que yo?

translation.en: I know I can.
-May the best beer win. -[scoffs] Okay.
translation.es: - Que gane la mejor cerveza.- Bien.

translation.en: -Can I-- No. -[Adam] I'm not gonna fight you.
translation.es: ¿Puedo...? No voy a pelear. Llegaste después.

translation.en: -You got there after me. -Unfair.
translation.es: No voy a pelear. Llegaste después. Es injusto.

translation.en: -[Adam] Let go. -[Wilhelm] No.
-We're not-- -[Adam] Let go of my leg.
[Wilhelm] Why is this vest so slippery?
translation.es: ¿Por qué este chaleco es tan resbaloso?

translation.en: Be still, my hairless avenger. [sighs]
Just 15 more sleeps, big guy.
-I can hear you. -[Adam] No, I know.
You listening is an important part of the process.
translation.es: Que me oigas es importantepara el proceso.

translation.en: What time are you gonna go paint that house, you cretin?
translation.es: ¿A qué horavas a pintar esa casa, lelo?

translation.en: -What's a cretin? -A "cretin" is an idiot.
Typically, cretins don't know the word "cretin," so...
translation.es: Los lelos no suelen conocerla palabra "lelo".

translation.en: Why would you call a--
[Adam] Unbelievable.
-So, is the bat part of your recipe? -No. But this one is.
translation.es: - ¿El bate está en la receta?- No. Pero este sí.

translation.en: Hey, I found my keys
and another bat, Will.
Oh, shit, where's my wallet?
[Adam] Don't go back in.
Oh, what is that putrid smell? Right, no, I forgot.
translation.es: ¿Qué es ese olor putrefacto? Claro, sí, lo olvidé.

translation.en: You're brewing as well.
Oh! Acid attack. Oh, my God.
You should go back to your little monk buddies
and go milling again 'cause this is a ruined batch.
translation.es: y volver a empezar. Esto está arruinado.

translation.en: I know what I'm doing, okay?
Oh, that has been disproven time and again.
translation.es: Eso ha sido refutado en repetidas ocasiones.

translation.en: Get off of me, shitty beard!
[Sarah] Nothing like watching two betas fight.
translation.es: Nada como ver pelear a dos betas.

translation.en: I'm gonna digitally remove their clothes and sell this in Japan.
translation.es: Los desnudaré digitalmentey venderé esto en Japón.

translation.en: Hey, you're just nervous my beer is gonna be better than yours.
translation.es: Estás nervioso porque mi cervezaserá mejor que la tuya.

translation.en: [Adam] I'm never nervous!
-Stay there, you little fish. -No!
[laughs] Oh, I gotcha!
Do you give up?
-[grunts] Friar Lucas, attack! -[barks]
[Chuy] Oh, no.
translation.es: No. Fray Lucas,estoy muy sensible ahora.

translation.en: [Adam] Friar Lucas, I'm sensitive. I'm very sensitive right now, Friar Lucas.
translation.es: No. Fray Lucas,estoy muy sensible ahora. Ahora estoy muy sensible, Fray Lucas.Por favor, no...

translation.en: Please don't-- [moans]
translation.es: Ahora estoy muy sensible, Fray Lucas.Por favor, no...

translation.en: Oh, I'm ticklish. No, no, no, no. Ooh. [moans]
[grunting] Oh, boy! Oh, it's happening.
What is your problem? Give me that. -Come on. -Come on.
[groans] And I'm back to day one.
I prematurely ejaculated after 29 days. [sighs]
Is that ironic?
Good luck with the distributor today, man. Thank you, Elvis.
translation.es: - Buena suerte con el distribuidor hoy.- Gracias, Elvis.

translation.en: -[groans] -[sighs] Oh, hey, hold on. Take this.
-I don't want it. -It's for luck.
translation.es: - No quiero.- Es para la suerte.

translation.en: It's my gift to you. Take the gift. Nothing weird about it.
translation.es: Es mi regalo para ti.Acéptalo. No tiene nada raro.

translation.en: It's just one man giving another man a sandwich.
Where's that negative energy coming from? Your aura is wild right now.
translation.es: ¿De dónde viene esa energía negativa?Tu aura es un desastre.

translation.en: -[woman] Your fries. -Thank you. -I'm loving these chicken wings-- -[Wilhelm] You try it.
translation.es: - Tus papas.- Gracias. Me encantan las alitas.

translation.en: -Uh, fingers. Fingers. -[chuckles]
It's Becky.
Yeah, it is.
Ooh, look at you, Field of Dreams. You have zero chance with Becky.
translation.es: Mírate, Campo de sueños.No tienes ninguna posibilidad con Becky.

translation.en: She and Elvis are like the same person.
translation.es: Ella y Elvis son una persona.

translation.en: Oh, Will, I would not expect you to understand chemistry.
translation.es: Will, no esperabaque entendieras de química.

translation.en: -Here. I'll give you a free lecture. -Oh.
-[both moaning, laughing] -Becky, hey.
Look, I was wondering if I could get a little mustard.
Thank you. This is relish. That's good, though.
translation.es: Gracias. Esto es salsa de pepinillos.Pero está bien.

translation.en: Chemistry.
She practically stank of sex.
Yeah, because she's currently having it with her boyfriend.
translation.es: Sí, porque lo está teniendocon su novio.

translation.en: Hey, guys, the distributor's on his way.
-Shit. -Oh. Great.
Two brand-new IPAs and zero questions about the menu from my brother.
translation.es: Dos IPA nuevas y sin preguntasde mi hermano sobre el menú.

translation.en: -And let's keep it that way. -[Adam] Hmm.
[takes a deep breath] Okay.
[screams] Goal!
[laughing] Chivas scores!
-Chuy, put it away! -Yup. I have it recorded. It's old.
[inhales sharply] This is really good.
But this beer's fantastic.
I could sell this one. I want ten kegs of this.
translation.es: Podría vender esta.Quiero diez barriles. Me encanta.

translation.en: -This is great. -Ten kegs?
translation.es: Podría vender esta.Quiero diez barriles. Me encanta. - ¿Diez barriles?- Sí.

translation.en: -Yes. -Ten kegs? He wants ten kegs!
-[Wilhelm] We did it! -[Sarah cheers] We did it!
Ah, congratulations, buddy. It's your beer.
That is not my beer.
[shouts] We're still laughing. We're having fun!
I know it wasn't your beer.
translation.es: Sé que no era tu cerveza.

translation.en: I swapped them out at the last second so that you wouldn't lose your shit
translation.es: Las cambié a último momentopara que cuando ganara yo

translation.en: -when my beer won. -No, no.
-No. -You said you wouldn't do this.
translation.es: - No.- Dijiste que no harías esto.

translation.en: You're not letting me celebrate and gloat and have a good time.
translation.es: No me dejas celebrar y regodearme.

translation.en: No, we have bigger problems now. I pissed in your beer.
translation.es: Hay problemas más graves. Oriné en tu cerveza.

translation.en: -You what? -I pissed in your beer.
Guys, I taste a lot of beers.
This is so unique. It's distinctive.
You know what? Let's make it 20 kegs. I want to put this in every restaurant possible, all right?
translation.es: Que sean 20 barriles. Quiero venderlaen tantos restaurantes como pueda.

translation.en: -Yes! -Oh, my God!
-What are we gonna do? -I don't know.
You're an imbecile, and I don't have that much piss.
translation.es: Eres un imbécily no tengo tanto pis.

translation.en: Mmm! I love it!
